name: Wild Journeys
text:
BEWARE: Loyal customers read this carefully - Extremely disappointing, and it was not the food or staff.

The corporate office decided to use this particular restaurant as a pilot for a stripped-down ACFP take-out pizza joint. The entire bar is gone. There are only two choices of beer (Miller Lite and Peroni) if you choose to stay and sit at one of the remaining tables, which I did, you can't even get a cappuccino or a slice of cheese cake. The pictures, lighting and overall  ambiance are no longer there. Gone. They even removed the pictures in the bathrooms. The music volume gets louder and quieter on its own and the staff has been decimated. There is no longer table service, you order at the front desk. They bring it to you. It was a cruel bait and switch.

After 10 years of loyalty to ACFP in Ft. Lauderdale, Plantation, Coral Springs, Wellington and Sand Lake I am shocked my favorite all time location is less than half the wonderful memory making place it was for me and my friends. I even planned to eat there this Wednesday night with my family and next week during one of my many business luncheons  throughout the year (I travel from downtown Orlando). Not any longer. I can't, it doesn't exist. It will be hard for me to eat there again. I will likely not be ordering take-out from the stripped-down facade either.

I have spent thousands of dollars for more than a decade and now there is nothing. As loyal customers there was no attempt to contact the local patrons to the changes. Nothing.

In time, alcohol sales will plummet (I am sure they have) and the Altamonte ACFP will become confused with the pizza joint across the street named - Anthony's. Corporate has rolled the dice, but my guess is they may have jumped the shark on this one.

If they reopen the full bar and restore table service, I will definitely be back, but otherwise it will be a rare occasion. Sand Lake or perhaps Tampa, I hope.

Right after church we were looking for a different place to have lunch. Nothing fancy, just my husband, my 6 yr old grandson and I. My grandson wanted Wings, so we stepped at Anthony's and ordered a cheese large pizza, 2 ice teas, large order of wings & an individual small pizza fir my grandson.  The wings were very tasty and well seasoned; the teas were watered down considerably;  the cheese pizza was way too thin and we expected "cheese," but there was more sauce than cheese; and lastly the small cheese pizza was just as thin and hardly any cheese with lots of sauce....plus it had large burnt bubbles, which my grandson did not want to eat from it...
Well, I figured, someone in the kitchen had a bad day, so maybe next time it will be better.  Then, came the check..... $5.98 for 2 watered down teas, $20.99 for the large wings (which, as I said were good, but not for that price!!),the "cheese"less pizzas: the large was over $16.99 and the individual burnt one was $8.99. With tax etc the check came at a wopping $56.64!!

I did give the waitress $6.36 tip, to round up the total to $63.00, Angelina worked courteously and was attentive.

Now, I don't plan on returning any time soon.  The prices need to be commensurate with the product one purchases.  I do not find this to be true at Anthony's of Altamonte Springs.  Sorry!

name: Debra Davids
text:
I wish that I could gave Anthony's Coal Fired Pizza in Altamonte Springs a better review than 2 stars, but my recent experience there (and we have enjoyed their pizza many times in the past) was far from 5-star.
More than 6 months ago we contacted Anthony's to book a reservation for 40 people for a major family party. In January we personally visited the restaurant to confirm with the manager on duty the date, time and number of people we were expecting. We even saw the memo that was posted scheduling the date and time for our party. And last week we called in our order, in advance, and reconfirmed the date and time and number of guests. So when we arrived last Friday to find that the staff were totally unprepared for our party, we were very disappointed. We were told that we were not expected to arrive until 1 hour later in spite of the fact that every conversation we had with Anthony's confirmed the time for dinner. So we and our 40 guests stood at the bar (there was no place to sit) for more than 1 hour while diners finished eating so that the tables could be set for our party. Even the 4 elderly people (2 handicapped, one on a walker and one with a cane) had to stand with the rest of us. What was perhaps most disappointing, if the fact that Anthony's management totally dropped the ball on our arrangements wasn't enough, was the apparent lack of  genuine concern for our predicament. No manager stepped up and took responsibility for the mismanaged reservation. No one appeared to make our 40 guests an urgency. I would of thought that some "courtesy" might have been extended to us and our guests for the inconvenience which was the fault of Anthony's and not ours, but none was forthcoming.  Once we were finally seated there wasn't even any evidence that anyone was interested in expediting service for our party. We were told that the kitchen was expecting us an hour later and that was that.
As for the food-  the pizzas, salads, wings and desserts- all was as expected. And I was sure to generously tip the servers on the food and drinks since the problems we encountered were not their fault). But I would discourage anyone from planning on entertaining a large party at Anthony's Coal Fired Pizza in Altamonte Springs regardless of how many visits and conversations there were in making the arrangements.
Will we eat again at Anthony's? Probably. But I will think twice if our dinner party is any larger than 4 people.

text:
Mixed feelings about this place.  One time it's great, next time, not so much.  First visit, the Manager is all friendly and offering complimentary wings, which were delicious.  He's like, oh, let me know when you bring your family back.  Second visit, we brought our brother and sister in law, raving about the place.  Tried to flag down the manager several times to say hi, but he ignored us.  My husband drives right by there on his way home from work, so we've gotten to go orders several times.  He has refused to eat the food there anymore.  Two to-go orders ago, our large order of wings, which costs $21, was completely smothered with like a pound of the caramelized onions thus making the wings inedible because they were covered in grease.  The Family sized salad is always good, but the lettuce was not drained and completely wet with water, which dilutes the delicious salad dressing!  Tonight's order was for me only, because hubby says he won't eat the food anymore.  I told the gal taking the order I wanted all flats on my wings and she says no problem, but we were charged extra for that.  Well, I got mostly drums, which I don't care particularly like.  The wings used to be nice and meaty, but there was very little meat on all of my wings that I attempted to eat, they were very large, but boney, which is kind of odd.  Anthony's had better get their consistency game on or they're not going to be open in 6 months from losing customers.  When you get take out food and order things specifically, you get it home and you can't change it, so what are you going to do, stand in the restaurant and unpack it all to check it?  Not convenient.  We won't be coming back.

I challenge you to answer this review, because it appears you only reply to the good ones.  And/or find a way to get the to go orders right so when folks get their food home, they can actually eat it.  Ours went in the garbage tonight.

Oh, and they have a Philly Cheese Steak PIZZA.  But when I asked if we could get a Philly Cheese Steak Sub, the girl quickly said NO.  Seriously?  You're from New York and you won't serve a Sub when you have the ingredients?  Bad business.
